task: Pouring a Liquid from Bottle to Cup

steps.description: Hold the bottle upright and remove any cap or lid if necessary.
Align the spout of the bottle over the cup, ensuring it is directly above the target container.
Slowly tilt the bottle to begin pouring the liquid into the cup.
Adjust the tilt to control the flow of liquid, ensuring the right amount is poured into the cup.
Once the desired amount of liquid is in the cup, return the bottle to its upright position.
If the bottle has a cap, replace it securely after pouring.

action_roles.description: The person performing the pouring action, responsible for controlling the bottle and directing the liquid flow.
The bottle, which contains the liquid and is used to pour it into the cup.
The liquid, which is transferred from the bottle into the cup.
The cup, which receives the liquid from the bottle.
The surface on which the cup is placed to receive the liquid.
